title: Linux TBB SFTP URI allows local IP disclosure
vulnerability_information:
Browsing to a simple URL to an sftp URI allows bypasses socks proxy for DNS and browsing.
Tested on a clean install of Ubuntu 16.04 with TBB 7.0.2 (4097d43aa0be86ae3fe43ec8f3ac5394) download from https://www.torproject.org/dist/torbrowser/7.0.2/tor-browser-linux64-7.0.2_en-US.tar.xz
 
POC:
Navigate to sftp://104.131.180.179:80/index.php

After ~1 minute check http://104.131.180.179/ip,txt for your IP address

It appears that ubuntu's default SSH client is associated with this URI which causes the client to attempt the connection on behalf of the user. The windows TBB does not appear to be affected. 

Excerpt from apache logs:
apache2: [core:error] [pid 10671] [client x.x.x.x:40063] AH00126: Invalid URI in request SSH-2.0-OpenSSH_7.2p2 Ubuntu-4ubuntu2.1

Not surprisingly, the client can also be directed to local resources as well.
vulnerability_information_html:
Browsing to a simple URL to an sftp URI allows bypasses socks proxy for DNS and browsing.
Tested on a clean install of Ubuntu 16.04 with TBB 7.0.2 (4097d43aa0be86ae3fe43ec8f3ac5394) download from https://www.torproject.org/dist/torbrowser/7.0.2/tor-browser-linux64-7.0.2_en-US.tar.xz

POC:
Navigate to sftp://104.131.180.179:80/index.php

After ~1 minute check http://104.131.180.179/ip,txt for your IP address

It appears that ubuntu's default SSH client is associated with this URI which causes the client to attempt the connection on behalf of the user. The windows TBB does not appear to be affected.

Excerpt from apache logs:
apache2: [core:error] [pid 10671] [client x.x.x.x:40063] AH00126: Invalid URI in request SSH-2.0-OpenSSH_7.2p2 Ubuntu-4ubuntu2.1

Not surprisingly, the client can also be directed to local resources as well.

activities.message: To be clear, instead of local IP disclosure, this should just be disclosure of real IP address.
activities.markdown_message: To be clear, instead of local IP disclosure, this should just be disclosure of real IP address.

activities.message:
Thanks for this report. I gave that a quick try on a Debian testing system but could not reproduce your report so far. Here is what I did:

1) I took a vanilla Tor Browser 7.0.2.
2) I started Wireshark to capture network traffic.
3) I entered sftp://104.131.180.179:80/index.php in the URL bar which lead me to  DuckDuckGo.
4) I looked at my Wireshark output and all traffic went through Tor.
5) After a while I visited http://104.131.180.179/ip.txt and my IP address did not show up.

I try to get my hands on some Ubuntu machines. Maybe I can reproduce your bug there.

Did you do step 3) as well or something different and did you get the same result (the URL getting passed to DuckDuckGo)?
activities.markdown_message:
Thanks for this report. I gave that a quick try on a Debian testing system but could not reproduce your report so far. Here is what I did:

1) I took a vanilla Tor Browser 7.0.2.
2) I started Wireshark to capture network traffic.
3) I entered sftp://104.131.180.179:80/index.php in the URL bar which lead me to DuckDuckGo.
4) I looked at my Wireshark output and all traffic went through Tor.
5) After a while I visited http://104.131.180.179/ip.txt and my IP address did not show up.

I try to get my hands on some Ubuntu machines. Maybe I can reproduce your bug there.

Did you do step 3) as well or something different and did you get the same result (the URL getting passed to DuckDuckGo)?

activities.message: Okay, I found a machine where I could reproduce this bug. Thanks. We are investigating it right now and are working on a fix.
activities.markdown_message: Okay, I found a machine where I could reproduce this bug. Thanks. We are investigating it right now and are working on a fix.

activities.message: Step 3 on an gresh install of ubuntu on virtualbox does not forward me to duckduck go. The page times out instead.  On a windows box however I am redirected to duckduckgo. I can test this on the ubuntu live install if you want. I could also record a video of the poc if it would help.

I can test this on the ubuntu live install if you want. I could also record a video of the poc if it would help.

activities.message: Looks like I was typing my reply at the same time. Thanks and let me know if I can help!
activities.markdown_message: Looks like I was typing my reply at the same time. Thanks and let me know if I can help!

activities.message: Okay, I think I have a workaround for your bug (but am still investigating what exactly is going wrong and whether it does not open up other holes). Could you test that one? Here are the steps: 1) In your Tor Browser open about:config and create a new preference (by right-clicking on the page). Select the boolean option. 2) The name of the new preference would be network.protocol-handler.external.sftp and the value would be true 3) Now visit your PoC-URL 4) The URL should get passed on to DuckDuckGo and you should see no leaks in Wireshark (nor your IP address in the ip.txt file).
activities.markdown_message:
Okay, I think I have a workaround for your bug (but am still investigating what exactly is going wrong and whether it does not open up other holes). Could you test that one? Here are the steps:

1) In your Tor Browser open <code>about:config</code> and create a new preference (by right-clicking on the page). Select the boolean option.
2) The name of the new preference would be <code>network.protocol-handler.external.sftp</code> and the value would be <code>true</code>
3) Now visit your PoC-URL
4) The URL should get passed on to DuckDuckGo and you should see no leaks in Wireshark (nor your IP address in the ip.txt file).

activities.message:
Alright, I think we have a better fix for your issue. I made a Tor Browser bundle containing it. Could you test the build on your machine(s) and report back if it fixes the problem for you:

https://people.torproject.org/~gk/testbuilds/tor-browser-bugXXXXX-test.tar.xz
https://people.torproject.org/~gk/testbuilds/tor-browser-bugXXXXX-test.tar.xz.asc

activities.message: I tested this build and it does appear to fix this issue. I am redirected to duckduckgo and see no leakage in my network capture. Thanks for the quick resolution!

activities.message: We are still working on it. Thanks for your report, really appreciated. Afterwards I'll get back to your report (doing the remaining admin things and rewarding you).

activities.message: I greatly appreciate the update.  I have another one to submit but I am on the fence as to whether it is actually a security issue or not. In short, a person running another browser may be able to get the user name of a person who is running a tbb. However I don't think that the person would be able to tie this to the current tor session. Is this something i should submit or is it outside the guidelines?

Would you care filing a ticket there and explaining your idea? There might be nothing we can do about that but maybe there is, hard to say. Thanks!

activities.message: Yes. I am trying to route around the bureaucracy that is currently blocking on getting our balance updated and I got green light to pay you the bug bounty directly from our money. The final thing I am trying to figure out is how this will be impact the HackerOne reputation system etc. as we are basically paying the bounty outside of their platform. I'll do that tomorrow and hope to have an answer to that question shortly. Barring any further surprises we can then try to get you the money you deserve. Would you, as kind of a compensation, like to get a Tor t-shirt as well? (We don't have special bug bounty swag yet, though, it would be a "normal" Tor t-shirt)

activities.message:
Alright, to give a status update:

Plan A (just giving you the bounty you should get via the "normal" HackerOne channels) is still not working. There seems still to be some bureaucratic hurdle which is not easily surmountable which I don't understand.

Now, Plan B has been to give you the money direct from us but transfer it to the HackerOne  bank account to get it to our balance and continue with the "normal" HackerOne work flow. However, this fails currently as HackerOne does not seem to be able to get back to me with  their banking details. :(

Now, let me try a Plan C...
